history.proof: intros H1 H2. induction l as [| x xs IH]. - inversion H2. - inversion H2 as [| fxs m H4 H5]. + shelve. + shelve.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type
Y: Type
f: X -> Y
l: list X

Goal:
(forall x y : X, In x l -> In y l -> f x = f y -> x = y) -> list_has_dup (map f l) -> list_has_dup l

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
In : forall A : Type, A -> list A -> Prop
list_has_dup : forall X : Type, list X -> Prop
map : forall A B : Type, (A -> B) -> list A -> list B
measure_rect : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> nat) (P : X -> Type), (forall x : X, (forall y : X, m y < m x -> P y) -> P x) -> forall x : X, P x
in_map_iff : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A) (y : B), In y (map f l) < -> (exists x : A, f x = y /\ In x l)
map_ext_in_iff : map ?f ?l = map ?g ?l < -> (forall a : ?A, In a ?l -> ?f a = ?g a) where ?A : [X : Type Y : Type f : X -> Y l : list X |- Type] ?B : [X : Type Y : Type f : X -> Y l : list X |- Type] ?f : [X : Type Y : Type f : X -> Y l : list X |- ?A -> ?B] ?g : [X : Type Y : Type f : X -> Y l : list X |- ?A -> ?B] ?l : [X : Type Y : Type f : X -> Y l : list X |- list ?A]
map_cons_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (ll : list X) (y : Y) (m : list Y), map f ll = y :: m -> {x : X & {l : list X | ll = x :: l /\ f x = y /\ map f l = m}}
map_middle_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (ll : list X) (m : list Y) (y : Y) (n : list Y), map f ll = m ++ y :: n -> {l : list X & {x : X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ x :: r /\ map f l = m /\ f x = y /\ map f r = n}}}
In_list_in_map_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (l : list X) (f : forall x : X, In x l -> Y) (y : Y), In y (list_in_map l f) -> exists (x : X) (Hx : In x l), y = f x Hx
list_has_dup_ind : forall (X : Type) (P : list X -> Prop), (forall (l : list X) (x : X), In x l -> P (x :: l)) -> (forall (l : list X) (x : X), list_has_dup l -> P l -> P (x :: l)) -> forall l : list X, list_has_dup l -> P l
list_has_dup_sind : forall (X : Type) (P : list X -> SProp), (forall (l : list X) (x : X), In x l -> P (x :: l)) -> (forall (l : list X) (x : X), list_has_dup l -> P l -> P (x :: l)) -> forall l : list X, list_has_dup l -> P l
eqdec = fun X : Type => forall x y : X, {x = y} + {x <> y} : Type -> Type Arguments eqdec _%type_scope
ListDec.decidable_eq = fun A : Type => forall x y : A, Decidable.decidable (x = y) : Type -> Prop Arguments ListDec.decidable_eq _%type_scope
in_map : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A) (x : A), In x l -> In (f x) (map f l)
in_in_remove : forall (A : Type) (eq_dec : forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) (l : list A) (x y : A), x <> y -> In x l -> In x (remove eq_dec y l)
in_flat_map : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> list B) (l : list A) (y : B), In y (flat_map f l) < -> (exists x : A, In x l /\ In y (f x))
Forall_impl : forall (X : Type) (P Q : X -> Prop) (ll : list X), (forall x : X, In x ll -> P x -> Q x) -> Forall P ll -> Forall Q ll
remove : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> A -> list A -> list A
find_some : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (l : list A) (x : A), find f l = Some x -> In x l /\ f x = true
list_dec : forall (X : Type) (P Q : X -> Prop), (forall x : X, {P x} + {Q x}) -> forall l : list X, {x : X | In x l /\ P x} + {forall x : X, In x l -> Q x}
count_occ : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> list A -> A -> nat
flat_map_concat_map : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> list B) (l : list A), flat_map f l = concat (map f l)
filter_ext_in : forall (A : Type) (f g : A -> bool) (l : list A), (forall a : A, In a l -> f a = g a) -> filter f l = filter g l
In_list_assoc : forall (X Y : Type) (eq_X_dec : eqdec X) (x : X) (l : list (X * Y)), In x (map fst l) -> {y : Y | list_assoc eq_X_dec x l = Some y /\ In (x, y) l}
map_ext_in : forall (A B : Type) (f g : A -> B) (l : list A), (forall a : A, In a l -> f a = g a) -> map f l = map g l
incl_left_right_php : forall (X : Type) (x : X) (l : list X) (y : X) (m : list X), incl (y :: m) (x :: l) -> list_has_dup (y :: m) \/ x = y /\ incl m l \/ In y l /\ incl m l \/ In y l /\ (exists m' : list X, m ~p x :: m' /\ incl m' l)
nodup : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> list A -> list A
list_has_dup_app_inv : forall (X : Type) (l m : list X), list_has_dup (l ++ m) -> list_has_dup l \/ list_has_dup m \/ (exists x : X, In x l /\ In x m)
NoDup_map_inv : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A), NoDup (map f l) -> NoDup l
in_flat_map_Exists : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> list B) (x : B) (l : list A), In x (flat_map f l) < -> Exists (fun y : A => In x (f y)) l
filter_In : forall (A : Type) (f : A -> bool) (x : A) (l : list A), In x (filter f l) < -> In x l /\ f x = true
list_injective_rect : forall (X : Type) (P : list X -> Type), P nil -> (forall (x : X) (l : list X), ~ In x l -> P l -> P (x :: l)) -> forall l : list X, list_injective l -> P l
BinInt.Z.lt = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
partition_intersection : forall (X : Type) (l m k : list X), length k < length (l ++ m) -> incl (l ++ m) k -> list_has_dup l \/ list_has_dup m \/ (exists x : X, In x l /\ In x m)
Permutation_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> list A -> Prop), P nil nil -> (forall (x : A) (l l' : list A), l ~p l' -> P l l' -> P (x :: l) (x :: l')) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), P (y :: x :: l) (x :: y :: l)) -> (forall l l' l'' : list A, l ~p l' -> P l l' -> l' ~p l'' -> P l' l'' -> P l l'') -> forall l l0 : list A, l ~p l0 -> P l l0
map_app_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (ll : list X) (m n : list Y), map f ll = m ++ n -> {l : list X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ r /\ m = map f l /\ n = map f r}}
in_prod : forall (A B : Type) (l : list A) (l' : list B) (x : A) (y : B), In x l -> In y l' -> In (x, y) (list_prod l l')
notin_flat_map_Forall : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> list B) (x : B) (l : list A), ~ In x (flat_map f l) < -> Forall (fun y : A => ~ In x (f y)) l
in_remove : forall (A : Type) (eq_dec : forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) (l : list A) (x y : A), In x (remove eq_dec y l) -> In x l /\ x <> y
In_t : forall X : Type, X -> list X -> Type
in_prod_aux : forall (A B : Type) (x : A) (y : B) (l : list B), In y l -> In (x, y) (map (fun y0 : B => (x, y0)) l)
BinInt.Z.le = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
in_elt_inv : forall (A : Type) (x y : A) (l1 l2 : list A), In x (l1 ++ y :: l2) -> x = y \/ In x (l1 ++ l2)

Proof:
```
intros f l H1 H2.
induction l as [| x xs IH].
- intros H3. inversion H2.
- intros H3. inversion H2 as [| fxs m H4 H5].
  apply H1 with (x:=x) (y:=x).
  + left. reflexivity.
  + left. reflexivity.
  + now apply IH.
```

original: intros f l H1 H2. induction l as [| x xs IH]. - intros H3. inversion H2. - intros H3. inversion H2 as [| fxs m H4 H5]. apply H1 with (x:=x) (y:=x). + left. reflexivity. + left. reflexivity. + now apply IH.
